that looks like a corrupt disk to me
it works still tho, its my mp3 player and it works fine under xp
yea, windows is notorious for skimming over errors and not paying enough attention -- have you tried mounting the disk like this -- sudo mount -t vfat /dev/sdb1 /mnt/sdb1
mount point does not exist
ok -- make it then -- sudo mkdir /mnt/sdb1
operation not permitted
on which command tho?
mkdir: cannot create directory `/mnt/sdb1': Operation not permitted
are you sure you used sudo with mkdir there
sudo mkdir /mnt/sdb1
fdisk reports it as /dev/sdb ...
you can try this -- sudo sh -c "mkdir /mnt/sdb1; mount -t vfat /dev/sdb1 /mnt/sdb1"
you've already checked -- you pasted it here - http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/52233/
that didnt work mkdir again
ok, try this then - sudo sh -c "mkdir /media/sdb1; mount -t vfat /dev/sdb1 /media/sdb1"
usually you dont have to mess with mount on the command line, your device should automatically mount
i know but both of my usb things i have connected have had some major issues
in this case, it probably failed to mount because of the invalid parition table on the device which is why we had to resort to the command line
